title: Improv 101 with Brad McMurran
description:
Jump into the wonderful and wild world of improv comedy!!!

Learn the beginnings of Chicago-based, long form improv. Students will learn how to create scenes based off of audience suggestions. They will learn the fundamentals of 'Yes, And,' how to support scene partners' ideas and energy, and how to make strong character choices.

Absolutely no experience in acting or comedy is needed. The Push Comedy Theater strives to create a fun, safe and supportive experience for all students.

At the end of the session, students will take part in a graduation show on the Push Comedy Theater stage.

This class meets six times from 6:30pm-9:30pm on Tuesday evenings from May 28th through July 2nd.

Cost: $210

--The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting and film production.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.
full_description:
Jump into the wonderful and wild world of improv comedy!!!


Learn the beginnings of Chicago-based, long form improv. Students will learn how to create scenes based off of audience suggestions. They will learn the fundamentals of 'Yes, And,' how to support scene partners' ideas and energy, and how to make strong character choices.

Absolutely no experience in acting or comedy is needed. The Push Comedy Theater strives to create a fun, safe and supportive experience for all students.

At the end of the session, students will take part in a graduation show on the Push Comedy Theater stage.


This class meets six times from 6:30pm-9:30pm on Tuesday evenings from May 28th through July 2nd.

Cost: $210


--
The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.
The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting and film production.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Musical Improv 101
description:
The Push Comedy Theater brings you MUSICAL IMPROV!!!

This course offers an introduction to long form musical improvisation. We will cover the basics of how to work with music while learning how to create two person musical numbers, placing them together to create a 15 minute thematic musical show.

Additional focus will be on sound exploration, movement, stylization, and accessing voice. Prepare to challenge yourself while having a ton of fun! This course culminates with a graduation show.

Prerequisites: Improv 101

This course is 6 weeks long

Cost $240

This class is held on Sunday afternoons, noon to 3pm, June 2nd through July 14th.

There will be no class July 4th weekend.

This class is held at the Push Comedy Theater Training Center. 2710A Granby Street, Norfolk, VA

title: Stand-Up Comedy 101 with Hatton Jordan
description:
Learn how to perform stand-up comedy!

Learn about the often-overlooked basics of stand-up comedy and the nuances of fine tuning your act from almost-jaded veteran comic Hatton Jordan.

This class focuses on learning three skills: HOW to craft an original set, HOW to host a show like a pro and HOW to market yourself so club bookers will want to pay you. This course culminates with YOU and the others in your class performing your set at your Grad Show at the Push Theater.

The class will be a 6 week course ending with a graduation show at the 90 seat Push Comedy Theater.

Class will be held Thursdays from 6:30pm to 9:30pm, June 6th through July 18th.

There is no class July 4th.

This Class is held at the Push Comedy Theater Training Center

Tutition is $210

This class is taught by local comedian Hatton Jordan. Hatton has been in the stand-up game for 25 years and has made money telling jokes in more than 15 states and worked such clubs as the House of Blues in New Orleans, the Comedy Cabana in Myrtle Beach SC,  the DC Improv in Washington and he's even written for Mad Magazine.

title: Improv 201 at the Push Comedy Theater
description:
Improv 201 at the Push Comedy Theater

This course builds upon the fundamentals and skills learned in 101. Students will learn the beginnings 'The Harold' a long form improvisation structure developed by Del Close. They will learn how to identify the 'game' of a scene and how to heighten these games to develop 'second beats'.

At the end of the session, students will take part in a graduation show on the Push Comedy Theater stage.

This is a 6 week class.Cost $210


This class will be held from 6:30-9:30pm on Tuesday nights from June 11th through July 16th.


This Class is Held at the Push Comedy Theater Training Center

2710 Granby Street . Norfolk
full_description:
Improv 201 at the Push Comedy Theater

This course builds upon the fundamentals and skills learned in 101. Students will learn the beginnings 'The Harold' a long form improvisation structure developed by Del Close. They will learn how to identify the 'game' of a scene and how to heighten these games to develop 'second beats'.

At the end of the session, students will take part in a graduation show on the Push Comedy Theater stage.

This is a 6 week class.
Cost $210

This class will be held from 6:30-9:30pm on Tuesday nights from June 11th through July 16th.

This Class is Held at the Push Comedy Theater Training Center

2710 Granby Street . Norfolk

title: Improv 501: Improv Studio
description:
This course focuses on giving students individual attention to their strengths and weaknesses. We will also break down the different components of improv scenes and the choices that improvisers have and make within those scenes.

This course will focus primarily on giving the students a deeper understanding of the Harold.

Improv 501 is a 4 week course.Mondays, 6:30 PM  June 17th thru July 8th



Prerequisites: Improv 401 Cost: $150
full_description:
This course focuses on giving students individual attention to their strengths and weaknesses. We will also break down the different components of improv scenes and the choices that improvisers have and make within those scenes.

This course will focus primarily on giving the students a deeper understanding of the Harold.

Improv 501 is a 4 week course.
Mondays, 6:30 PM June 17th thru July 8th


Prerequisites: Improv 401
Cost: $150

title: Sketch Comedy Writing 101
description:
Unleash your inner Will Ferrell, Tina Fey and Amy Poehler!!!

Sketch Comedy Writing 101

Here's your chance to dive head first into the wonderful world of sketch comedy! Whether you're a seasoned writer or someone who rarely (or never) picks up a pen, this class will teach how to get the funny ideas out of your head and onto the page.

We will examine the various types of sketches, learn how to generate funny ideas and then turn them into sketches ready for the stage. This class is open to everyone, no writing or comedy experience is needed.

The class will consist of 4 weeks of instruction followed by 2 weeks of rehearsal.At the end of the session, students sketches will appear in their own SNL-style showPrerequisites: none Cost: $220 This class will be held on Monday nights from 6:30-9:30 pm, July 1st through August 5th at the Push Comedy Theater Training Center.
full_description:
Unleash your inner Will Ferrell, Tina Fey and Amy Poehler!!!


Sketch Comedy Writing 101


Here's your chance to dive head first into the wonderful world of sketch comedy! Whether you're a seasoned writer or someone who rarely (or never) picks up a pen, this class will teach how to get the funny ideas out of your head and onto the page.


We will examine the various types of sketches, learn how to generate funny ideas and then turn them into sketches ready for the stage.

This class is open to everyone, no writing or comedy experience is needed.

The class will consist of 4 weeks of instruction followed by 2 weeks of rehearsal.
At the end of the session, students sketches will appear in their own SNL-style show

Prerequisites: none
Cost: $220

This class will be held on Monday nights from 6:30-9:30 pm, July 1st through August 5th at the Push Comedy Theater Training Center.

title: Improv 401: Advanced Harold
description:
Improv 401: Advanced Harold

Now we put it all together. Students will combine the skills learned in the previous courses for an in depth study of The Harold. This course will delve deeper into the form, focusing on editing scenes, individual and group commitment, as well as the components of 2-person, 3-person, and group scenes.

At the end of the session, students will take part in a graduation show on the Push Comedy Theater stage.

Prerequisites: Improv 301
	

Improv 401: Advanced Harold is a 6 week course.

Tuesday nights from July 2nd through August 6th, 6:30pm to 9:30pm.

The price of this course is $210.

$60 for students taking 401 for a 2nd time.
full_description:
Improv 401: Advanced Harold


Now we put it all together. Students will combine the skills learned in the previous courses for an in depth study of The Harold. This course will delve deeper into the form, focusing on editing scenes, individual and group commitment, as well as the components of 2-person, 3-person, and group scenes.


At the end of the session, students will take part in a graduation show on the Push Comedy Theater stage.


Prerequisites: Improv 301

Improv 401: Advanced Harold is a 6 week course.

Tuesday nights from July 2nd through August 6th, 6:30pm to 9:30pm.

The price of this course is $210.

$60 for students taking 401 for a 2nd time.

title: Pre-Teen Improv Camp
description:
Pre-Teen Improv Summer Camp 

This camp is open to children ages 8 to 12.

Students will explore the key elements of both long and short form improvisation. The children will play numerous improv games which will serve to develop and enhance their public speaking, social, and team-building skills.

The camp is conducted in a non-judgmental environment where the students build confidence, make friends, and most importantly… have fun.

Camp runs from 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM, Monday through Friday, with a graduation performance.

Each student will receive a "Pullers/Push Comedy" t-shirt that they (will keep and) wear at the graduation show.

Snacks and beverages will be provided every day during the morning break.

These are all beginner level sessions, no experience is necessary.

Tuition is $200 per student.

Pre-Teen Improv Camp 

July 22nd thru 26th, 9am to 12pm

title: Teen Improv and Sketch Comedy Summer Camp
description:
Jump head first into the wonderful world of improv and sketch comedy. This camp is open to teens from the age of 13 to 17, and absolutely no experience is needed.

Students will explore the key tools behind both long and short form improvisation. We will play numerous improv games which will help to sharpen your mind and strengthen your public-speaking, social and team-building skills.

Students will also explore the fundamentals of creating a written and rehearsed sketch comedy show!

We strive to create a safe, non-judgmental environment where teens can build confidence, make friends, and most importantly ... have fun.

At the end of camp, all students will take part in a graduation show on the Push Comedy Theater stage.

Session Tuition: $200

Teen Improv and Sketch Comedy Summer Camp 

July 22nd thru 26th, 1pm to 4pm
full_description:

Students will also explore the fundamentals of creating a written and rehearsed sketch comedy show!

We strive to create a safe, non-judgmental environment where teens can build confidence, make friends, and most importantly ... have fun.

At the end of camp, all students will take part in a graduation show on the Push Comedy Theater stage.

Teen Improv and Sketch Comedy Summer Camp

title: Musical Improv 201
description:
Musical Improv 201

This class is focused on building a long form Musical Harold. It will improve upon the concepts and skills learned in Musical Improv 101, with a focus on finding deeper relationships and themes to bring to life through song.

Be prepared to play with unique 2nd beats, duets, genres, and movement.

This course culminates with a graduation show.

Prerequisites: Musical Improv 101

This course is 6 weeks long

Cost $240

This class is held on Sunday afternoons, noon to 3pm, July 28th through September 8th.

There is no class Labor Day Weekend.

title: Pre-Teen Improv at the Push Comedy Theater
description:
Don't miss out on the fun!!! Sign up your kids, grand kids, nieces, nephews, even the stinky neighbor kid from down the street for KidProv at the Push Comedy Theater.

This class is open to children ages 8 to 12. Students will explore the key elements of both long and short form improvisation. The children will play numerous improv games which will serve to develop and enhance their public-speaking, social and team-building skills.

This class will be conducted in a non-judgmental environment where the students will build confidence, make friends and most importantly ... have fun

The session concludes with the students performing in a graduation show on the Push Comedy Theater Stage.

This class will be held from 10am-12pm on Saturday mornings from September 28th through November 2nd.

This is class is $180 for new students and $160 for returning students.

---
